column1: #Text=Polycrystalline  samples  of  FeSe0.35Te0.65 were  prepared by  a low-pressure  synthesis  method.

#Text=We  used  three  types  of  Fe:  57Fe  enriched  powder  (M57=57.00)  (ISOFLEX  USA,  purity  99.99%),  54Fe  enriched  powder  (M54=54.01)  (ISOFLEX  USA,  purity  99.99%),  and  natural  Fe  powder  nFe  (Mn=55.85)  (Showa Chemical Industry, purity 99.9%).
#Text=As preliminaries, Se shots and Te powder were prepared and ground in a glove box in a N2atmosphere.
#Text=The mixture was divided into two with the same weight and then mixed with two different iron isotopes respectively in order to rule out differences in the Te content.
#Text=The mixed powders were pressed into two pellets in a glove box.
#Text=These two pellets were sealed in a quartz vacuum ampoule  to  rule  out  differences  in  synthesis  temperature  and  then  heated  at  700Υfor  24  h.
#Text=After  regrinding  two  pellets  the  same  procedures were carried  out.
#Text=Three  combinations  of  Fe  isotope  pairs S1(nFe  and  57Fe),  S2  (57Fe  and  54Fe), andS3(54Fe  and  nFe)  were  obtained.
#Text=Powder  x-ray  diffraction  measurements  were  carried  out  by  using  CuKD\radiation.
#Text=All  the  samples  have  a  single  phase  and  differences   in   lattice   parameters   between   two   samples   synthesized   simultaneously   are   negligible.
#Text=Measurements  of  ac  susceptibility  were  carried  out  by  using  commercial  equipment  (Quantum  Design  Physical Property Measurement System) to determineTcof samples.
